short_description: Outputs volume-weighted average price (VWAP) based on specified interval
long_description: Outputs the volume-weighted average price (vwap)for a specified interval on the columns specified in 'price' and 'volume' note that all columns in the partition by clause are passed through. Interval is 0 by default.

input_tables.name: input
input_tables.rDescription: The table containing the input data.
input_tables.description: The table containing the input data.

argument_clauses.name: Price
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the price at which the item traded. The default value is 'price'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the price at which the item traded. The default value is 'price'.

argument_clauses.name: Volume
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the number of units traded in the transaction. The default value is 'volume'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the number of units traded in the transaction. The default value is 'volume'.

argument_clauses.name: Dt
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the date and time of the trade. The default value is 'dt'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the date and time of the trade. The default value is 'dt'.

argument_clauses.name: TimeInterval
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the number of seconds in each time interval. The default value is 0, which makes each row an interval, causing the function to calculate no averages.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the number of seconds in each time interval. The default value is 0, which makes each row an interval, causing the function to calculate no averages.
